Our story

In the AI Era, modern technology should be at the backbone of supply chains, but the word is not quite there yet. From retail stores all the way up to large-scale enterprise, professionals are craving tech solutions to run supply chain operations in much better ways, saving money and reducing the environmental footprint on our planet.

That‚Äôs why we are building Cargoful, an AI-based SaaS company that wants to elevate supply chains to the level they should be at.

We are a small team of young and international professionals who want to change how supply chains are run, from the ground up. We come from top companies and research centres (MIT, McKinsey, NASA, London Business School, Leonardo, Politecnico di Milano, Sant‚ÄôAnna), we are backed by leading institutions from the Silicon Valley (Berkeley SkyDeck) and Italy (s2capital, B4i) and driven by a strong will to make things happen.

We are looking for individuals to join us in building the supply chain tech of the future.

Responsibilities

Our new team member will work directly with our Chief Analytics Officer, and in collaboration with the rest of the engineering team, to design, create and deploy Optimization and Machine Learning algorithms.




Examples of activities you will perform:¬†

Create geo-spatial forecasting models to predict demand for last-mile deliveries
Optimize large scale combinatorial problems using Operations Research algorithms (metaheuristics, genetic algorithms or exact methods)
Build datapipeline to extract insights from vast amounts of GPS datapoints
Develop custom clustering algorithms to speed up optimization model
Collaborate closely with the Software Engineering team to deploy all model in production within a real Web Application




What we offer:

A driver‚Äôs seat in a small, selected and very ambitious team. At Cargoful, every single individual matters and is crucial in transforming our vision into reality. WhatsApp only had 50 employees when sold to Facebook for $16 billion in 2014. What can we achieve in the era of one-person-billion-dollar companies? Let‚Äôs find out together.
Direct exposure to complex problems with no easy solutions. Building groundbreaking technology isn't smooth - we confront an endless stream of technical and managerial challenges that will test you rigorously and drive you to learn and improve. We all aspire to be the best professionals we can be, and to achieve this, we push ourselves hard.
Ownership, responsibility, impact. Cargoful is already powering the supply chains of large multinational corporations - there's significant room for accountability and little margin for error. Each of us takes ownership, cares for the rest of the team, and stands up when needed




What we don't offer

Regularity & smooth sailing. Every day is completely different from the previous one. The span of activities is extremely wide but we expect you to become a ‚Äúlittle‚Äù expert in a variety of different fields. Your team-mates and clients will rely on you ‚Äì that means you‚Äôll need to be there when they need you.
The safe heaven of standards and procedures. We are building a brand new company and pre-cooked processes do not exists for us. We expect you to contribute to design how the company processes should look like in 2-5 years from now rather than adapting to rules.




Qualifications

Experience: 1-2 years
Education: Engineering, Math, Data science, Statistics or Physics degree
Language: At least B2 level (Intermediate) in English
Set-up: hybrid, 3 days/week in presence in our Milan office (Porta Romana)




Application instructions

To apply send an email to cosmo@cargoful.tech with a short intro of yourself. Strong customer focus and service attitude

Proactive approach to tasks & challenges

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to apply Data, ML & GenAI technology to create meaningful impact with digital products at scale, solve the needs of its users and tackle real-world problems in the world of digital & business? Are you up for the challenge to scale AI applications to hundred thousands of users, balancing best engineering practices and continuous user feedback? Then the role of a Senior Machine Learning Engineer will definitely trigger your interest!

In The Pocket's mission is to create digital products that make people happy and businesses grow. We believe both aspects are crucial for successful digital products, and they will often drive one another. Generative AI, Machine Learning & Data technologies allow us to improve both: by improving the experience of existing products, by enabling new business models based on newly uncovered insights and by enabling a whole range of new digital products with new value streams. Let's leverage ML & data to build even better digital products.







What you‚Äôll do:

You'll closely collaborate with ML Engineers, Product Managers, Architects, and Software Engineers to define, implement and improve use cases that are enabled through machine learning. You are responsible for the life-cycle of the AI solution. This includes designing, developing testing, improving deploying and scaling the model that is used. There will be a focus on MLOps and the ability to scale modern NLP applications both in amount of users and data. But you don't do this in a vacuum. Rather, you're part of a multidisciplinary team where every member is equally responsible for the product's success
You keep up with the latest Data, Machine Learning & Generative AI advances, with a particular focus on what might be applicable in our context. In particular, your enthusiasm for "what is possible" motivates you and we expect you to transfer that enthusiasm to your team members and even our clients
You actively participate in knowledge sharing both towards peers (lessons learned, new advances, process improvements,..) as well as other people in our organisation (e.g. sales, marketing, product, strategy...). And it doesn't have to stop there: we happily support any initiatives to share our findings with the world, through blogs, talks, podcasts or guest lectures
You clearly communicate and set expectations. What realistic results can be expected? What are the greatest risks/unknowns? Always be open and honest, and don't be afraid to ask for help







Who you are:

You hold a bachelor/master/PhD degree in Computer Science (or related), and a master in Data Science / AI / Statistics or Machine Learning - or you have a proven track record in a similar role
You have a profound knowledge of Python and at least one of the most important machine learning frameworks (Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch,...) and are able to work AI platforms like Huggingface, replicate and/or AI cloud services like Vertex AI Studio, AWS Sagemaker or Azure AI Studio
You have relevant experience in going beyond running local ML experiments, but bringing ML to production, including MLOps, Data versioning, & LLM Orchestration frameworks
You have a broad awareness of the possibilities and limitations of ML, and see how Data and ML can help us build even better products for our clients.
You have an affinity with product design and engineering top-notch digital products
You highly value the principles of clean code, continuous improvement and rapid prototyping. Experience with continuous delivery and/or devops practices is a plus
Any experience with the broader services from Google Cloud Platform, AWS or Azure is a plus
You excel in sharing your knowledge with others, you enjoy coaching team members and helping them to gain more insights in your field of expertise







Additional information:

Working at In The Pocket means accepting a high level of autonomy. We rely on trust and openness, and sharing our learning curve. At In The Pocket, there‚Äôs time to experiment and budget to develop yourself.




On a personal level, we‚Äôre looking for someone who shares our values:




Ownership: Working at In The Pocket means accepting a high level of autonomy. You take ownership and show the ability to decide and act for the good of the company
Integrity: Stick to your values, even when it doesn‚Äôt pay off in the short term. In The Pocket relies on trust and openness, which in turn relies on your integrity
Lead & Educate: Digital technologies are changing the world. We go all in, head-first. We take the lead in designing and building with emerging technologies. We share our passion and knowledge with as many people as possible.
Agility: In The Pocket is permanently under construction. We never settle, it‚Äôs never done. Observing, adapting and improving is in our nature. That resonates with the people who work here. We are always looking for a better solution, always ready for the next step, pragmatic and committed to moving forward
Team: As individuals, we are bright and talented, as a team we are unbeatable. We are open and positive, constructive and honest. We help and inspire our colleagues to do their best work.

Title: Software Engineer (Python)
Description:
Garda Capital Partners (Garda) is a multi-billion dollar alternative investment firm with over 20 years of experience deploying relative value strategies across fixed income markets for institutional investors. Garda has offices in Wayzata, New York City, West Palm Beach, Geneva, Zug, Copenhagen, Singapore, and Scottsdale.

Garda is looking to hire a Software Engineer (Python) to be a part of our Research and Technology (R&T) team based out of our Geneva office. This is an exciting position offering opportunities to gain exposure to enterprise software development practices at a global hedge fund.

Position Responsibilities:


Aid in the development of new lines of business solutions using Python, Excel and Relational Databases
Support senior staff in designing and implementing complete solutions for our front office/risk systems.
Provide support for in-house and 3rd party applications


Qualifications & Desired Skills:


1+ Year of object-oriented development, preferably with Python (using common programming design patterns and good practices)
1+ Year of relational database and SQL experience, data modeling, and database design
Experience with Excel a plus
Experience with Python Data Stack (Pandas, NumPy, SQLAlchemy, etc.
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Finance
Must be comfortable with development across the application stack
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Passionate about programming and technology
Interest in financial trading industry
Ability to work effectively in a high-energy, time sensitive team environment
Detail-oriented with strong verbal and written communication skills
Knowledge of fixed income trading and related financial instruments including bonds and interest rate derivative products preferred, but not required
